channel.title: QUESTION, for help reasons
channel.description:
ok well i got a question.
ok well to start off, i am makeing a source from start and me and a friend are running it. how can me and my friend run it on two diffrent computers at 2 diffrent locations?
after one is done running do i have to send it to him after i added to archive? and he reopens everything? or is there a auto updater that can update it when one is running and the other is off? like he runs it when im not home and i run it when im home and its always on with same stats and evverything?
post comments! please

item.title: QUESTION, for help reasons
item.dc:creator: @zaper123456 zaper123456
item.description:
@zaper123456 wrote:

ooo i see lol ok

Read full topic

item.title: QUESTION, for help reasons
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Just do it in the ‘Silab Format’
Have them written to a downloadable file on one server, which is up-to-date, and have the other server load that file.
The ‘Silab Format’

Read full topic

item.title: QUESTION, for help reasons
item.dc:creator: @zaper123456 zaper123456
item.description:
@zaper123456 wrote:

yeah i know about the ip and what your talking about, but how can you keep the charcter files updated with out the comotion?

Read full topic

item.title: QUESTION, for help reasons
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Send the server folder to him. You will have 2 servers modeled the same unless you update one and not the other. The diff would me the IP, players online, and their char files.

Read full topic
